channel.title: The Times of India Sports: Extensive sports coverage, key statistics and free downloads
channel.description: The Times of India Sports gives you latest sports coverage, scores and milestones; covers all sporting events, provides key statistics and free downloads

image.title: The Times of India Sports: Extensive sports coverage, key statistics and free downloads

item.title: Angelo leads SL to 3-wkt win over B'desh
item.description: Riding on skipper Angelo Mathews's spirited innings, Lanka registered a 3-wicket win over Bangladesh in their Asia Cup tie at Shere Bangla National Stadium.

item.title: Mathews slams 50 amid Lankan ruins
item.description: Chasing 205, Sri Lanka lost Chaturanga de Silva but were boosted by skipper Angelo Mathews's half-ton in their Asia Cup match against Bangladesh in Mirpur.

item.title: Matthews slams 50 amid Lankan ruins
item.description: Chasing 205, Sri Lanka lost Chaturanga de Silva but were boosted by skipper Angelo Matthews's half-ton in their Asia Cup tie against Bangladesh in Mirpur.

item.title: Matthews, De Silva revive SL run-chase
item.description: Chasing 205, Sri Lanka seemed to lose the plot as they lost crucial wickets in their Asia Cup tie against Bangladesh at the Shere Bangla National Stadium.

item.title: SL crumble against Bangladesh pacers
item.description: Chasing 205, Sri Lanka seemed to lose the plot as they lost crucial wickets in their Asia Cup tie against Bangladesh at the Shere Bangla National Stadium.

item.title: Hossain double-strike rattles Sri Lanka
item.description: Chasing 205, Sri Lanka got off to a bad start when Al-Amin Hossain struck to dismiss Kusal Perera and Kumar Sangakkara in their Asia Cup match in Mirpur.

item.title: Lanka lose Perera early in chase of 205
item.description: Chasing 205, Sri Lanka got off to a bad start when Al-Amin Hossain struck to dismiss Kusal Perera in their Asia Cup tie at the Shere Bangla National Stadium.

item.title: Sri Lanka restrict Bangladesh to 204/9
item.description: Good show by Suranga Lakmal (2/32) and Ashan Priyanjan (2/11) helped SL restrict B'desh to 204/9 in their Asia Cup tie at Shere Bangla National Stadium.

item.title: Sri Lankan spinners rattle Bangladesh
item.description: Sri Lankan spinners were on a roll as the Bangladesh batsmen crumbled against them in their Asia Cup match at Shere Bangla National Stadium in Mirpur.

item.title: 'Will quit the day I become a burden'
item.description: Hitting out at his critics for questioning his place in the Pakistan team, Shahid Afridi said he would quit the game the day he feels himself a burden on his team.

item.title: Mendis double blow rocks Bangladesh
item.description: Ajantha Mendis dismissed Shamsur Rahman and Mominul Haque in one over to rattle Bangladesh in the last league match of the Asia Cup in Mirpur.

item.title: B'desh off to a steady start against SL
item.description: Openers Anamul Haque and Shamsur Rahman brought up Bangladesh's 50 in the 14th over in the last league match of the Asia Cup against Sri Lanka.

item.title: I don't compete with Ashwin: Harbhajan
item.description: Experienced but out of favour off-spinner Harbhajan Singh says he is "not competing" with Tamil Nadu tweaker R Ashwin for a place in the Indian team.

item.title: Bangladesh opt to bat against Sri Lanka
item.description: Bangladesh captain Mushfiqur Rahim won the toss and chose to bat against Sri Lanka in the last league match of the Asia Cup in Mirpur on Thursday.

item.title: Former players heap praise on Smith
item.description: Former captains and fellow players were unanimous in their accolades for Graeme Smith who announced his retirement from international cricket earlier this week.

item.title: Saina in 2nd round of All England Open
item.description: Saina Nehwal emerged as the lone Indian survivor at the All England Championship, thrashing Kirsty Gilmour of Scotland to reach the second round.

item.title: Saina in 2nd round of All England Open
item.description: Saina Nehwal emerged as the lone Indian survivor at the All England Championship, thrashing Kirsty Gilmour of Scotland to reach the second round.

item.title: Meiyappan admits to 'friendly betting'
item.description: Gurunath Meiyappan admitted to 'friendly betting' in IPL 6 matches through actor Vindoo Dara Singh, Times Now reported quoting his interrogation report.

item.title: Ronaldo helps Portugal beat Cameroon
item.description: Ronaldo made the most of shambolic defending by scoring twice to help his team to a 5-1 friendly win and become Portugal's all-time leading scorer.

item.title: Neymar helps Brazil romp S Africa 5-0
item.description: Neymar scored a hat-trick as Brazil ended a run of narrow victories over South Africa by cruising to a 5-0 triumph at Soccer City stadium in Soweto.

item.title: India need Sehwag for World Cup: Lee
item.description: Brett Lee thinks Virender Sehwag needs to be in India's mix of things for the team to make an impact on the bouncy surfaces of Australia in the World Cup.

item.title: Australia push India to third spot
item.description: Australia replaced India at number two position in the Test team rankings by the virtue of their 245-run victory over South Africa in the third and final Test.

item.title: 'Staying motivated was a challenge'
item.description: "It was hard to motivate the team when you have been travelling and are out of contention for the final," Kohli said after India beat Afghanistan by 8 wickets.

item.title: India thrash Afghanistan by 8 wickets
item.description: Jadeja's magical figures of 4/30 followed by Shikhar and Rahane's 121-run opening stand helped India beat Afghanistan in their inconsequential Asia Cup tie.

item.title: India close to victory against Afghanistan
item.description: Chasing a paltry 160-run target, India closed in on victory in their inconsequential Asia Cup tie against Afghanistan at the Shere Bangla National Stadium.
